importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The article was updated on October 17, 2025, indicating a recent resurgence of military-style fashion, especially in the context of celebrity red carpet appearances and social media trends.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The resurgence of the Hussar jacket in fashion, particularly in 2025, reflects a current trend in high fashion and celebrity style, with increased online searches and appearances at major events like Paris Fashion Week.

keyTakeAways: The military-style Hussar jacket, historically a symbol of authority and uniformity, has been reimagined as a fashionable garment in modern fashion, particularly through celebrity influence.
Jodie Turner-Smith, Zendaya, Jenna Ortega, and Jimi Hendrix have all been linked to the revival of the Hussar jacket, demonstrating its cultural and stylistic relevance across generations.
The jacket’s revival is tied to both historical inspiration and subversive fashion statements, such as Jimi Hendrix’s unbuttoned, expressive styling and The Beatles’ anti-establishment aesthetic.
Luxury brands like Saint Laurent, Balmain, Gucci, and Marc Jacobs have contributed to the modern fashionization of the Hussar style, especially in the early 2000s.
The trend has gained momentum in 2025, with a 300% increase in global searches for 'Hussar jacket' in October 2025, signaling strong public interest and cultural relevance.

namedEntities.name: Jodie Turner-Smith
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She is a central example of the modern revival of military-style jackets, appearing at the Victoria’s Secret after-party in a black, white and red Hussar coat from Georgian brand Keburia.

namedEntities.name: Zendaya
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She was seen wearing a metallic fur-trimmed dress-coat at Louis Vuitton’s Paris Fashion Week, drawing inspiration from King Louis XVI, linking fashion to historical and royal aesthetics.

namedEntities.name: Jenna Ortega
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She wore a gothic black Hussar vest at Dior’s Paris Fashion Week, reinforcing the jacket’s presence in modern high fashion with intricate gold embroidery and aviator sunglasses.

namedEntities.name: Jimi Hendrix
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He popularized the subversive, bohemian use of Hussar pelisses in the 1960s, wearing them unbuttoned and with vibrant accessories, influencing later fashion reinterpretations of the jacket.

namedEntities.name: The Beatles
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: They used decorated military coats on the cover of 'Sergeant Pepper’s Lonely Hearts Club Band' as a form of anti-establishment protest, shaping the jacket's cultural symbolism as a statement piece.

namedEntities.name: Kate Moss
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She popularized the trend in 2005 by wearing an ivory Hussar jacket at Glastonbury, helping bring the style into mainstream consciousness.

namedEntities.name: Keburia
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The brand, based in Georgia, supplied Jodie Turner-Smith with a Hussar jacket, showcasing the global reach and availability of military-style outerwear in contemporary fashion.

namedEntities.name: Saint Laurent
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The brand contributed to the modern fashion revival of the Hussar jacket in the early 2000s with a cream wool coat featuring red trim and gold stitching.

namedEntities.name: Balmain
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The brand, like others, played a role in reinterpreting the Hussar jacket as a fashionable, subversive garment in the 2000s.

namedEntities.name: Gucci
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Gucci participated in the 2000s reinterpretation of the Hussar jacket, aligning with a broader trend of historical garments being reimagined for modern fashion.

namedEntities.name: Marc Jacobs
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: In 2002, Marc Jacobs presented a cream wool Hussar jacket with red trim and gold stitching, influencing the trend of blending historical military styles with modern aesthetics.

namedEntities.name: Jonathan Anderson
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He introduced a menswear collection at Dior where the Hussar jacket made a notable appearance, signaling the style’s continued presence in high fashion.

namedEntities.name: McQueen
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Recent collections by McQueen have featured the Hussar jacket, reflecting its ongoing integration into contemporary fashion.

namedEntities.name: Vaquera
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Vaquera’s recent collections include the Hussar jacket, showing its presence in modern, high-fashion design.

namedEntities.name: Ann Demeulemeester
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The brand has also incorporated the Hussar jacket into its recent collections, reinforcing the style’s resurgence in fashion.

namedEntities.name: Molly Rooyakkers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Fashion analyst and social media influencer
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She runs the fashion analytics account @styleanalytics and reported a 300% increase in global searches for 'Hussar jacket' in October 2025, indicating public interest in the trend.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The military-style Hussar jacket, historically associated with 18th-century European military uniforms, is experiencing a major fashion resurgence in 2025. Celebrities such as Jodie Turner-Smith, Zendaya, and Jenna Ortega have been seen wearing the jacket at high-profile events like the Victoria’s Secret after-party and Paris Fashion Week, reinterpreting it with modern, expressive styling. Influences from Jimi Hendrix, who wore the coat as a bohemian, subversive statement in the 1960s, and The Beatles’ anti-establishment use of military coats in the 1967 'Sergeant Pepper' era, have helped shape the jacket’s cultural meaning. Luxury fashion houses such as Saint Laurent, Gucci, and Marc Jacobs have also contributed to the revival, and the trend has gained significant public attention, with global searches for 'Hussar jacket' increasing by 300% in October 2025. This resurgence reflects a broader trend of historical fashion items being reimagined for contemporary expression, blending heritage with modernity and celebrity influence.
title: Look of the Week: From Jimi Hendrix to Jodie Turner-Smith, why fashion loves a military jacket
